posts.content:
Ok, 

So I asked about the risen lord one last time, however for RP purposes I don't think it will fit so well. I might still go down that path, however I'm looking to build something a little more versatile. I'm looking for help to build something decent. I have found going Druid/Monk/Shifter works fantastic for AC, but my AB is extremely poor. What can I do to raise this? Do I have to sacrifice Monk to get it low 40s? 

So, as before I'm restricted to 30 level
I must take 3 levels in the same class together before I can start mixing (so if I'm 5 druid, I need to do at least 3 shifter before I can do something else) 
It is a low magic world.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi Scylon

I'm not a shifter builder but I think Mick Daggers Yip, Yip You're dead build might have some answers

The build uses Kobold Commando form, the base strength stat is transferred when shifted unlike most forms, which improves its AB. It also takes weapon focus / epic weapon focuses which would further improve the AB in Kobold form.

I was toying with the idea of a shifter zen archer build but unfortunately there are no shifted forms which have a ranged attack, as far as I am aware...

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Is there a particular shape that you're looking for? Dragon Shape and Epic Kobold Commando are usually the highest AB forms available to a shifter, but if you want very high AB you will have to sacrifice AC. I think Dragon Shape can be taken without needing 30 WIS on Arelith but I don't know the details.

If you want a detailed build we would need a lot more information about Arelith.
What sort of AB/AC values are you looking for?
What item level is available on Arelith? +3 AB / +3 AC? Is it possible to get +12 abilities via gear?
Are the ability changes from subraces and gifts removed when shifted? For example, a Dwarf that shifts into a Kobold Commando will lose 2 CON since the bonus +2 CON from Dwarf is removed, we need to know if that applies to subraces/gifts too.
Are there any changes to shifted forms or are they all vanilla shapes?
Is item merging changed from vanilla NWN or is it the same?
Does Monk WIS AC apply while shifted?

Without knowing any of those, my recommendations would be either Dru24/Monk6 dragon or Monk6/Dru7/Shif17 kobold. I won't be able to calculate the AB/AC values without knowing the above information though.

Very detailed reply. I'll answer all as best I can:

If you want a detailed build we would need a lot more information about Arelith - 
Shifters are unchanged, However Dragon shape is off the table as only druids get it on the cheap, shifters get shafted. Also, Monk AC/UBAB don't translate to dragon shape anymore. It changes the main hand to a magic staff (not quarter staff)
Druids are basically the same. 
Monks are a little different, the things that are relavent to a 6 level dip are: 
  • Monk Weapon Proficiency: This feat allows effective use of club, dagger, handaxe, light crossbow, heavy crossbow, nagitata, quarterstaff, sai, shuriken, kama, katana, sling and wakizashi.
  • Lvl 2: gains feat - Weapon Focus: Unarmed (free)
What sort of AB/AC values are you looking for - I'm Flexible on AC. 45-55 range seems easy with monk. AB however I can't seems to get over mid 30s at best. i'd like low 40s

What item level is available on Arelith? +3 AB / +3 AC? Is it possible to get +12 abilities via gear - You can get +12 in 2-3 stats via items and buffs. You can generally dedicate to +12 in one stat easy if you wanted too. 

Are the ability changes from subraces and gifts removed when shifted?  - Gifts I can get +2 hard bonus in 2 stats that will count towards feats. Normal rules around shifting from normal NWN. So if it removes it there, it will remove it here, and vise versa. 

Are there any changes to shifted forms or are they all vanilla shapes - All are normal for shifter

Is item merging changed from vanilla NWN or is it the same - No changes here

Does Monk WIS AC apply while shifted - Yes, but not for dragon shape

As a side note: Dru25/Monk5 dragon is possible with 25 wisdom and no feat cost (you can get it free). However the monk UBAB and Wis AC will not translate to dragon shape. Might work better with 4 fighter for that guy.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
If Dragon Shape is out then Epic Kobold Commando is probably the best choice. Epic Kobold Commando shape gives you a +6 EB Shortsword so you shouldn't have a problem with DR from spells or Dragon Shape. It also means that you can leave out AB/EB on your weapon and focus on more damage or other weapon buffs.

If Monk WIS AC works in kobold shape then a WIS based Dru7/Shif17/Monk6 is fairly strong. Assuming that you have +12 DEX, +12 WIS, and one +3 AC item, you're looking at around +43AB/67AC. It only has 3 APR, but the AB is near the cap for a non-dragon.
A STR based Dru5/Shif17/Figh8 with +12 STR, +12 DEX, and one +3 AC item will have around +46AB/48AC. It has 4 APR and EWS: Shortsword but the AC is low and the stealth skills are worse than the Monk version. Even with a +2 STR gift the STR and DEX scores are almost the same, so personally I would go for a CON based version.
A CON based Dru5/Shif17/Figh8 with +12 DEX, +12 CON, and one +3 AC item will have around +45AB/48AC and 706 HP. You don't have enough feats to get EDR3 as well but if you're willing to sacrifice some things you can fit it in.
All three builds can get Undead Shape and the monk can get Outsider Shape too.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
I went for a human with both CON and WIS gifts, if that's not what you want it's fairly easy to change. If there are subraces that increase CON or WIS then they might be worth considering.

This is just a rough draft so I haven't done the skill progression. You have enough skill points to max Discipline, Hide, Listen, Move Silently, Spellcraft, and Tumble. The rest will go to skills that require training and either Animal Empathy, Concentration, or Lore.

If you want IExp then the only spare pre-epic feat is Toughness. Maybe swap it for Knockdown since the build only gets IKD at level 30.
If you want a spare epic feat then you can either drop Great Wisdom or Outsider Shape. If I was to change anything then I would switch Outsider Shape for ESF: Discipline since none of the shapes are very impressive offensively. Rakshasa magic immunity might be useful for PvM tanking but the Ice Storm is very weak (4d6 Cold + 3d6 Bludgeoning). However since your AC will probably be higher than your Discipline it might be better to stick with the current feats and leave ESF: Discipline. Epic Fortitude is another useful epic feat but without experience on the server I don't know if you will need it or not.

Due to how item merging works it doesn't matter which slot has AC since it all merges to Deflection. Only the highest AC value from all of your slots matter, so this can free up some space when choosing your equipment.
A major problem with item merging is that ability enhancements don't stack, it will be very hard to get +11 DEX and +12 WIS with vanilla item merging. I suggest looking for a weapon with ability enhancements, since your shortsword will have +6 EB regardless of the base weapon. A +3 DEX armor and a +3 DEX weapon will stack for +6 DEX when shifted, but a +3 DEX armor and a +3 DEX shield won't stack. Buffs like Cat's Grace will work normally, so either carry a lot of potions or try to party with a friendly caster.

posts.author: Scylon
posts.content:
Having tested it out, I can say the strongest forms are: 

Stone Golem - meh
Rakshasa - okish
drow warrior - oishish
mindflayer - meh
risen lord - very good even with this build
vampire - good, but the DC is crap
kobold commando - best by far. 

Is there any way to get the DCs higher?

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
The DC is 25 + your target's CON modifier, so no. However once they fail the save gets progressively harder since their fortitude decreases while the DC remains the same.
You should try out Gargoyle and Manticore shapes too, Gargoyle has decent defences and spamming Manticore spikes in IExp works very well against opponents without DR.

Your main shape when solo is Kobold Commando, the main backup shapes are Manticore and Risen Lord. The build should do very well at PvM tanking in a party. Gargoyle, Risen Lord, and Rakshasa all have great defences, and combined with IExp you should be able to AC tank a lot of monsters while the rest of your party kills them. Vampire can work against tough enemies since the level drain is tough to remove, however your fights will last a very long time while waiting for them to roll badly. I've killed people in PvP by level draining them to death but with this build Kobold Commando should finish the job much faster.
